content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools are committed to leveraging technology to enhance teaching and learning, prepare students for success in a digital world, and develop responsible digital citizens. Technology serves as a tool to support pedagogical goals, not as an end in itself.

content.title: Strategic Objectives
items: Teaching and Learning Enhancement: Integrate technology meaningfully into curriculum delivery to personalize learning and develop 21st-century skills.
Infrastructure Development: Maintain robust, reliable, and secure IT infrastructure.
Digital Literacy and Citizenship: Develop students' digital literacy skills and responsible technology use.
Staff Professional Development: Build staff capacity to integrate technology effectively through ongoing professional development.
Data Security and Privacy: Protect data through robust cybersecurity measures and compliance with regulations.

content.text: Digital learning initiatives are embedded within the School Improvement Plan (SIP) and monitored through EduNav dashboards.

subsections.title: EduNav Platform: School Information System and Learning Management System

content.text: EduNav is the integrated School Information System (SIS) and Learning Management System (LMS) deployed across all Eduversal Partner Schools.

content.title: Core Functions
items: Student Information System (SIS) Functions: Enrollment management, attendance tracking, gradebook management, scheduling, parent communication, and administrative reporting.
Learning Management System (LMS) Functions: Course content organization, assignment management, online quizzes, discussion forums, resource library, and communication tools.

content.title: User Access and Roles
items: Students: Access to personal academic records and course materials.
Teachers: Access to class rosters and course management tools.
Parents/Guardians: Access to their child's academic progress and communication.
School Administrators: Full access to administrative functions.
Eduversal Central: Oversight access for quality assurance.

content.title: Teacher Responsibilities in EduNav
items: Maintain current and organized course content.
Provide clear directions and update the gradebook regularly.
Encourage student communication and report technical issues.

content.title: Data Quality Assurance
items: Regular audits and quality checks at the beginning, mid-term, and end of the term.

content.text: Schools maintain robust network infrastructure to support digital learning.

content.title: Network Infrastructure
items: Sufficient bandwidth for simultaneous use.
Content filtering at the network level.
Secure authentication for authorized users.

content.title: Classroom Technology
items: Interactive Flat Panels for engaging instruction.
Projectors and display equipment where necessary.

content.title: Device Ecosystem
items: iPads and Chromebooks for student learning.
Teacher devices for classroom management.

content.title: Mobile Device Management (MDM)
items: Enrollment in MDM systems for device management.
Monitoring and security policy enforcement.

content.title: Device Care and Responsibilities
items: Students must handle devices with care and report issues.
Teachers must monitor student device use during lessons.

content.title: BYOD Policy
items: Personal devices may be permitted with parent consent.
Must comply with school network security requirements.

content.text: The AUP establishes guidelines for appropriate use of school technology resources.

content.title: Student Acceptable Use Policy
items: Permitted uses include educational activities and approved research.
Prohibited uses include accessing inappropriate content and cyberbullying.

content.title: Staff Acceptable Use Policy
items: Technology use should support teaching and learning.
Prohibited uses include sharing student information through unauthorized channels.

content.title: Parent/Guardian Access and Responsibilities
items: Use credentials securely and access only information related to their child.
Report concerns about technology safety promptly.

content.title: AUP Agreement Process
items: Annual agreement signed by students and parents.
AUP published in Student and Parent Handbook.

content.title: Consequences for AUP Violations
items: Minor violations may result in verbal warnings.
Serious violations may lead to suspension or expulsion.

content.text: Schools implement multi-layer content filtering to protect students from harmful content.

content.title: Content Filtering Strategy
items: Network-level filtering for all internet traffic.
Device-level filtering through MDM policies.

content.title: Monitoring and Reporting
items: Web browsing history logged for managed devices.
Automated alerts for concerning search terms.

content.title: Cyberbullying Prevention and Response
items: Digital citizenship education in curriculum.
Clear expectations in AUP.

content.text: Digital citizenship is taught explicitly and integrated across subjects.

content.title: Key Topics
items: Responsible use of technology.
Protecting personal information and privacy.
Recognizing and reporting online dangers.

content.title: Age-Appropriate Instruction
items: Primary: Basic internet safety and kind communication.
Lower Secondary: Social media awareness and cyberbullying recognition.
Upper Secondary: Advanced digital literacy and ethical use of AI.

content.title: Parent Education
items: Information sessions on online safety.
Resources on parental controls and monitoring.

content.text: Schools implement comprehensive cybersecurity measures aligned with regulations.

content.title: Security Framework
items: Preventive controls including firewalls and antivirus protection.
Detective controls such as network monitoring.
Corrective controls including incident response procedures.

content.title: Password and Account Security
items: Minimum password requirements and regular changes.
Unique accounts for each user.

content.title: Data Backup and Recovery
items: Daily automated backups of critical systems.
Documented recovery procedures.

content.title: Incident Response
items: Detection and initial assessment.
Containment and notification to relevant parties.

content.text: Eduversal recognizes AI as a tool that can enhance teaching and learning when used ethically.

content.title: Permitted Uses of AI
items: Lesson planning assistance and resource creation.
Research assistance and information synthesis for students.

content.title: Prohibited Uses of AI
items: Submitting AI-generated work as own without disclosure.
Using AI during assessments unless explicitly permitted.

content.title: Disclosure Requirements
items: Students must acknowledge AI assistance in their work.
All final work must reflect the student's own understanding.

content.title: Teaching About AI
items: Professional development on AI integration for teachers.
Age-appropriate instruction for students on AI.

content.text: Schools utilize vetted educational applications that support curriculum delivery.

content.title: Approved Educational Applications
items: Edpuzzle for video lessons.
Google Docs for online collaboration.

content.title: Application Selection Criteria
items: Educational value and alignment with curriculum objectives.
Data privacy and security compliance.

content.title: Application Approval Process
steps: Pilot Testing: Trial with limited group.
Contract Review: Legal review of terms.

content.text: This policy applies to all community members using social media.

content.title: Student Use of Social Media
items: Maintain respectful conduct and protect privacy.
Avoid using social media for academic dishonesty.

content.title: Staff Use of Social Media
items: Maintain professionalism and protect student confidentiality.
Avoid forming personal relationships with students.

content.title: Official School Accounts
items: Only authorized staff should manage official accounts.
Content must align with school values and be approved before posting.

content.text: Schools integrate online and face-to-face learning to enhance educational outcomes.

content.title: Blended Learning Models
items: Flipped classroom and station rotation models.
Online resources for enrichment and remediation.

content.title: Remote/Online Learning Provisions
items: Teachers must follow established schedules and maintain engagement.
Students must attend sessions punctually and communicate difficulties.

content.title: Video Conferencing Guidelines
items: Use school-approved platforms and enable waiting rooms.
Maintain appropriate dress code and professional backgrounds.

content.text: Technology integration should follow effective principles.

content.title: Principles of Effective Technology Integration
items: Start with learning goals and introduce technology purposefully.
Engage students with interactive learning experiences.

content.title: Appraisal Criteria for Technology Integration
items: Evaluate LMS usage and technology integration in teaching.
Monitor digital policy availability and communication.

content.title: Professional Development
items: Required training on EduNav and device management.
Ongoing support through IT help desk and peer mentoring.

content.text: Educational technology procurement follows specific principles.

content.title: Procurement Principles
items: Educational value and security compliance.
Total cost of ownership and sustainability.

content.title: Procurement Process
steps: Pilot Testing: Trial with limited group.

content.title: Vendor Partnerships
items: Maintain partnerships with trusted vendors.
Ensure compliance with data protection requirements.

content.title: Principal Responsibilities
items: Overall accountability for technology policy implementation.
Champion digital learning initiatives.

content.title: IT Coordinator/Manager Responsibilities
items: Day-to-day management of IT infrastructure.
User support and help desk management.

content.title: Academic Leadership Responsibilities
items: Promote effective technology integration in teaching.
Support teachers in using digital tools.

content.title: Teacher Responsibilities
items: Implement technology effectively in teaching.
Monitor and manage student device use.

content.title: Student Responsibilities
items: Follow Acceptable Use Policy and use technology responsibly.
Develop digital citizenship skills.

content.title: Parent/Guardian Responsibilities
items: Support school technology policies at home.
Monitor student technology use.

content.title: Eduversal Central Responsibilities
items: Provide EduNav platform and support.
Monitor compliance through appraisal process.

content.title: Annual Review Process
items: Gather stakeholder feedback and analyze technology performance data.
Review committee meets and revisions finalized.

content.title: Inputs to Review
items: Technology usage data and security incident reports.
Stakeholder feedback from surveys.

content.title: Version Control
items: Document all updates with version number and date.
Retain previous versions for reference.

subsections.title: Key Evidence and Artifacts for Accreditation

content.title: Documentation for Accreditation
items: Digital Learning Strategy document.
Acceptable Use Policy with signed acknowledgment records.
Technology inventory and maintenance records.

content.text: Compliance with CIS/WASC standards and Indonesian regulations.

content.title: Standards and Regulations
items: CIS/WASC standards for learning environments.
Indonesian Personal Data Protection regulations.

content.title: Appendices
items: Acceptable Use Policy Agreement Form (Student)
Device Care Agreement Form
BYOD Registration and Agreement Form
